DataElement.preferredName: Mammalian Target Rapamycin Biochemical Pathway Activation Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text descriptor of the condition of the mammalian target of Rapamycin or mTOR pathway, important for the energy and nutrient levels in cells and cell growth.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Mammalian Target Sirolimus Biochemical Pathway Activation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A class of warm-blooded vertebrate animals having the skin more or less covered with hair; young are born alive except for the small subclass of monotremes and nourished with milk._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination._A natural macrocyclic lactone produced by the bacterium Streptomyces hygroscopicus, with immunosuppressant properties. In cells, sirolimus binds to the immunophilin FK Binding Protein-12 (FKBP-12) to generate an immunosuppressive complex that binds to and inhibits the activation of the mammalian Target Of Rapamycin (mTOR), a key regulatory kinase. This results in inhibition of T lymphocyte activation and proliferation that occurs in response to antigenic and cytokine (IL-2, IL-4, and IL-15) stimulation and inhibition of antibody production. (NCI04)_An elaboration of the sequence of chemical reactions leading from one compound to another taking place in living tissue._To cause something to start or to stimulate activity.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A class of warm-blooded vertebrate animals having the skin more or less covered with hair; young are born alive except for the small subclass of monotremes and nourished with milk.:The goal intended to be attained.:A drug used to help prevent rejection of organ and bone marrow transplants by the body.:An elaboration of the sequence of chemical reactions leading from one compound to another taking place in living tissue.

Concepts.definition: A class of warm-blooded vertebrate animals having the skin more or less covered with hair; young are born alive except for the small subclass of monotremes and nourished with milk.
An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.

A natural macrocyclic lactone produced by the bacterium Streptomyces hygroscopicus, with immunosuppressant properties. In cells, sirolimus binds to the immunophilin FK Binding Protein-12 (FKBP-12) to generate an immunosuppressive complex that binds to and inhibits the activation of the mammalian Target Of Rapamycin (mTOR), a key regulatory kinase. This results in inhibition of T lymphocyte activation and proliferation that occurs in response to antigenic and cytokine (IL-2, IL-4, and IL-15) stimulation and inhibition of antibody production. (NCI04)
A series of biochemical reactions which occurs in a known sequence and can result in all or part of the initiation, progression or completion of a biological process or function.
